law.catch_line: The grant funds shall consist of:...

text.section:
The grant funds shall consist of:
moneys specifically appropriated for the Child Care Quality Incentive Grant Program; and
any other moneys made available to the Child Care Quality Incentive Grant Program.

The Child Care Quality Incentive Grant Program shall be used to:
pay all expenses and disbursements authorized by the State Department of Education for administering the Child Care Quality Incentive Grant Program; and
award direct incentive grants to child care providers.

To be eligible to receive grants under this part, a child care provider must:
possess a certificate of registration or license that is current and not subject to any pending regulatory action, including revocation and suspension; and
not be in arrears in the payment of any moneys owed to the State, including the payment of taxes and employee benefits.

Grants made under this part shall be limited to:
child care centers located in Title I communities;
child care centers where at least 25% of the children enrolled receive subsidies through the purchase of child care program; and
family child care homes and large family child care homes that serve children who receive child care subsidies through the purchase of child care program.
